review_blob: Tap at the Slip, York. Very sweet, slightly smoky. Translucent (when it settles)  and dark. Persistent head. Alcohol is too prominent.

On tap at the Slip, York. Persistent head, clear. Suspect the overriding factor in the design was alcohol percentage. Alcohol dominates, slightly malty. Ive had 7% beers which taste much milder, this is emphatically not in that category. Hops are difficult to find, although I suspect a fair few will have been used. Random fact: burped and tasted honey after drinking. If this was the idea, the brewer is sublime. If, as is most likely, this was unrelated to the beer, it has resulted in an undeserved boost to my rating. Please see future reviews to find out if it was an anomaly
Cask at Golden Ball, York. Very clear, not much head. Weak flavour, so more of a session beer (in mitigation, though, my previous was a 6.7% stout!)
beer_name: Treboom Yorkshire Sparkle Really Pale Ale

review_blob: Lots of head, took a while to settle. Not very carbonated though. Smells smoky/burnt, as expected. Syrupy texture, tastes of bitter chocolate, burnt marshmallows, whisky, beer. Rapidly recedes to a sweet, soft aftertaste. Perhaps a little too much alcohol on the nose, but this is a common affliction of beers of a certain strength
beer_name: HaandBryggeriet Ryk Uten Ild (Smoke Without Fire)
